result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian R Brozynski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Bond amount posted shall be applied.  lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall have no contact with Fleet Farm.

Defendant shall have no contact with Jeremy R. or Jason P.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall take medication as prescribed.  

Defendant shall submit to random drug and alcohol screens. 

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian R Brozynski

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian R Brozynski in court, in custody.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Brian R Brozynski.  (Jefferson Co. 21CM119; Waukesha Co. 21CF1831)  Defendant states missed court as was first day of training for new job and tried to reschedule.  Defendant states will come to court and tried to reschedule and currently in meetings/treatment and has a good support system.  Court concerned defendant will not appear when ordered.  Atty. Jensen states the defendant was turning himself in on Monday, which counsel observed, and because of the backup the Sgt. suggested he go to Waukesha Co. for court and then was transferred on this warrant.  State requests cash bond be increased by an additional $300.00.  Court denies increase and maintains $750.00 cash bond as posted.
